tool.name: Beacon2 Bracket
tool.description: Specifies a sequence ranges for both the start and end positions of a genomic variation
tool.command: beacon2-search bracket --db-host '$db_host' --db-port $db_port --database $database --collection $collection #if str($advanced_settings.authenticated_access.auth_req) == "yes": $advanced_settings.authenticated_access.advance_connection --db-auth-source $advanced_settings.authenticated_access.db_auth_source --db-user $advanced_settings.authenticated_access.db_user --db-password $advanced_settings.authenticated_access.db_password #end if --referenceName $referenceName --start-minimum $start_minimum --start-maximum $start_maximum --end-minimum $end_minimum --end-maximum $end_maximum #if str($advanced_settings.variantType) --variantType $advanced_settings.variantType #end if > bracket_query_findings.txt

param.label: Reference Name
param.help: Reference name in numbers chr1/1, chr2/2, chr3/3, etc.

param.label: VARIANT TYPE
param.help: Targeted Variant type to search for

tool.help: Bracket Queries allow the specification of sequence ranges for both start and end positions of a genomic variation. The typical example here is the query for similar structural variants - particularly CNVs - affecting a genomic region but potentially differing in their exact base extents.
